definition: the act of moving forward (as toward a goal), to rise in rate or price, situated ahead or going before
details:
noun
- the act of moving forward (as toward a goal)
= synonyms: advancement
- increase in price or value
= example: increase in price or value
= synonyms: rise
- a tentative suggestion designed to elicit the reactions of others
= example: a tentative suggestion designed to elicit the reactions of others
= synonyms: approach, feeler, overture
- a change for the better
= synonyms: betterment
- a movement forward
= synonyms: progress
- an amount paid before it is earned
= synonyms: cash advance
verb
- to rise in rate or price
= example: to rise in rate or price
= synonyms: gain
- to develop in a positive way
= example: to develop in a positive way
= synonyms: progress
- to increase or raise
= example: to increase or raise
= synonyms: boost, bump up, supercharge
- to develop further
= example: to develop further
- to bring forward for consideration or acceptance
= example: to bring forward for consideration or acceptance
= synonyms: throw out
- to obtain advantages, such as points, etc.
= example: to obtain advantages, such as points, etc.
= synonyms: gain, win, pull ahead, make headway, get ahead, gain ground
- to move forward, also in the metaphorical sense
= example: to move forward, also in the metaphorical sense
= synonyms: progress
- to cause to move forward
= example: to cause to move forward
= synonyms: bring forward
- to move forward
= example: to move forward
= synonyms: set ahead
- to pay in advance
= example: to pay in advance
- to give a promotion to or assign to a higher position
= example: to give a promotion to or assign to a higher position
= synonyms: raise
- to contribute to the progress or growth of
= example: to contribute to the progress or growth of
= synonyms: further, boost, encourage, promote
adjective
- situated ahead or going before
= synonyms: in advance
- being ahead of time or need
= synonyms: beforehand
